item.title: Academic Activities
item.description: Teaching Teaching Assistant, Delft University of Technology Web Science and Engineering, a graduate course offered in the first period at Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science (Sep 2018 - Jan2019) Digital Skills, a pilot course to make first-year bachelor students in non-CS programs learn programming in Python (Sep 2018 - Jan2019) Talks “Working with real-time location data in your IoT projects”, Amrita University, Coimbatore, 2016.

item.title: Projects
item.description: I enjoy dabbling on code, some towards a large projects while others are explorations of new tools - they are open-sourced and can be found on Github. I hope to update my blog with learning experiences for these projects as and when time permits Featured Project An city-scale agent-based simulator to compare different intervention strategies during an epidemic: Code on Github A hybrid human-machine approach to preserve privacy in images: Code - coming soon!

item.title: Research
item.description: My current research interests are broadly in the topics of Human-centered AI, Natural Language Processing, Edge Intelligence, and Data-driven Modelling. This page has a few selected outcomes of ongoing and older research. You can always find the current research outcomes on Google Scholar Master Thesis: “A Human-Machine Approach to Preserve Privacy in Image Analysis Crowdsourcing Tasks”, TU Delft (2019). Manuscripts and Technical Reports P Parag, P Patil, S Shriram, R Sundaresan, H Tyagi, N K.
